title: Visual Analytics & Applications
text:
Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics & Applications! This subject focuses on the use of tools like Quarto and Tableau to create visualizations to analyze datasets. Basically, data analytics plus visualizations.
This is the homepage, so you are safe here. You will find my coursework in this website over the coming weeks.

title: Sandra Jacob
text: Hey there! I am a full-time business analyst, part-time MITB student, and I am looking forward to pivot into data science in the near future. My hobbies are gymming, painting and travelling. Feel free to reach out!

title: Hands On Exercise 1
text:
The code below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

show_col_types = FALSE
head(exam_data, n = 5)

# A tibble: 5 × 7
  ID         CLASS GENDER RACE    ENGLISH MATHS SCIENCE
  <chr>      <chr> <chr>  <chr>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>
1 Student321 3I    Male   Malay        21     9      15
2 Student305 3I    Female Malay        24    22      16
3 Student289 3H    Male   Chinese      26    16      16
4 Student227 3F    Male   Chinese      27    77      31
5 Student318 3I    Male   Malay        27    11      25

title: Hands On Exercise 1
text:
Data
First, let’s call the ggplot() function using the below code.

ggplot(data=exam_data)
